summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of an inmate who was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York from July 16-26, 2019. The inmate describes the events surrounding an incident where another inmate, implied to be Jeffrey Epstein, attempted suicide by hanging in his cell in the early morning hours, and details the officers' response and subsequent changes in SHU procedures.

events.title: Inmate Suicide Attempt at MCC
events.description: An inmate (implied to be Jeffrey Epstein) attempted to hang himself from the ladder of his bed in the SHU at MCC around 1:20am-1:30am. His cellmate woke up screaming, officers responded, found the inmate with a blue tone, and removed him without administering CPR.

keyFacts: An inmate attempted suicide by hanging in the MCC SHU around 1:20-1:30am; there had been no inmate check at midnight prior to the incident.
Officers did not administer CPR to the inmate, who appeared dead with a blue tone, and handled him roughly, dropping him hard onto a stretcher.
A lieutenant recorded the cell cleanup with a video camera but initially held it facing her leg, not recording the cell, only turning it to record after the cell was cleaned.
After the incident, procedures changed: officers started conducting regular inmate checks at 12am, 3am, and 5am, brought books to inmates, and improved phone call access.
The incident involved a makeshift ligature made from two orange socks and an orange towel tied together, which was removed from the cell.
